channel.title: Should I upgrade my RAM?
channel.description:
Right now I have 512MB of ram, and a ATI Radeon X300 graphics card.
I can play my games fine, but if I press the windows key insted of CTRL or somthing, all hell breaks loose and my comp lags.
Right now I have 2 256MB ram installed, 2 upgrade slots left open(that's 4 total), I can afford 1GB of RAM and was wondering, should I upgrade? I'd upgrade my graphics card(I don't need to but playing games in lowest quality sometimes is annoying, and if you have a good graphics card and low ram with the games graphics on highest, the comp will lag because the graphics card is faster than the ram) but can't seem to find any ones right for me.
Just wondering on your opinions. :D
Also, can someone explain Page File to me?

item.title: Should I upgrade my RAM?
item.dc:creator: @Aftermath.v2 Aftermath.v2
item.description:
@Aftermath.v2 wrote:

Hehe really? I just deleted all of the anime I’ve watched:

Ai Yori Aoshi
Ai Yori Aoshi ~ Enishi

Full Metal Panic!

item.title: Should I upgrade my RAM?
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

[quote=“Aukake, post:10, topic:14513”]You definately need to upgrade the graphics card if you think you’re going to be doing any sort of gaming other than runescape. I used to have the same card, I didn’t know how bad I had it. The RAM isn’t sooo bad, but that does seem to be another of your bottlenecks.

And when you say that you can afford 1GB of RAM do you mean adding another 512MB or adding 1GB?

HD size doesn’t really matter. I just burn all my movies (i’m guessing porn takes up a good chunk of your HD) to dvd’s and delete them.[/quote]

Actually, alot of my HD space is taken up by evangelion. I got the seriese and both movies on dvd but their not as good quality as the one on my harddrive.

I like my graphics card, I can play all my games fine(with the exception of Quake 4, single player is slow as hell and multi player because of my broadband), and I can afford to upgrade so I’ve got 1.5GB of ram.

Also, I need to format. There’s no getting away. I installed a program(Peek, lets you see the hex/binary stuff of files, I found it useless. I did find out who made most of RS music though). Anyways, when I right click somthing and choose open with(to open with more files) it opens them with notepad. Also, when I added another user account, scar messed up and now I need to drag the file into the scar window to use it. Somehow though, MS Paint got deleted.

I’ve done everything I’ve can. Done alot of registry editers, defragers and stuff. I’d rather format anyway, all I need to do is make a backup of everything I got onto my mums pc then format then send it back over. The stuff I need is less than 20GB, bit too big for CD’s but sending from my comp on msn to hers is so fast.

Also, thanks for the comments. I’ll upgrade my ram and save a new graphics card/more ram to later. The comp I’m on can hold 4GB of ram either way.

Read full topic

item.title: Should I upgrade my RAM?
item.dc:creator: @irfan786 irfan786
item.description:
@irfan786 wrote:

Omg did someone say they have 40gb hd?! You seriously need an upgrade. I have 300gb =)
Anyways Un-named, when I bought my comp it had 1gb RAM, I suggest you try to upgrade your RAM to 2gb because 1gb isn’t as good as your thinking. With 1gb, if you press crtl+alt+del while playing a cd game, the cd game will freeze/lag. If you don’t want your comp to freeze/lag during a game (which is really irritating) 2gb RAM is right for you.

Read full topic

item.title: Should I upgrade my RAM?
item.dc:creator: @Aukake Aukake
item.description:
@Aukake wrote:

You definately need to upgrade the graphics card if you think you’re going to be doing any sort of gaming other than runescape. I used to have the same card, I didn’t know how bad I had it. The RAM isn’t sooo bad, but that does seem to be another of your bottlenecks.

And when you say that you can afford 1GB of RAM do you mean adding another 512MB or adding 1GB?

HD size doesn’t really matter. I just burn all my movies (i’m guessing porn takes up a good chunk of your HD) to dvd’s and delete them.

Read full topic

item.title: Should I upgrade my RAM?
item.dc:creator: @ThAt0n36Uy Elijah
item.description:
@ThAt0n36Uy wrote:

I just bought a brand new 512 mb ram for my computer lol I wouldve bought a 1 gb but my computer cant handle it… I’d say it would totally help to get a new RAM just to speed it up…

Read full topic

item.title: Should I upgrade my RAM?
item.dc:creator: @googlethis googlethis
item.description:
@googlethis wrote:

On another topic

i only have 40gb, and its been fine for 5 years. only 1200mhz processor too lols

Really? I’ve been operating off of 1.5gb and 133 mhz processor for about 3 years

Aftermath.v2:

The page file is used to store memory to a file, as far as I know. Even if enough RAM is available, data is still stored on the page file. I suggest cleaning up your hard drive of junk (I just cleared 186 Gigabytes of files), uninstall what you don’t need, and defragment your hard drive.

186 gb…was it all old porn vids?

Read full topic

item.title: Should I upgrade my RAM?
item.dc:creator: @leader leader
item.description:
@leader wrote:

Try Perfect Disk 8 and Cleaner. If you want to make your page file larger than follow these instructions:

  1. Right click on my computer and pick Properties.
  2. Go to the advanced tab
  3. Under the Performance heading it says settings, click on that.
  4. Go to the advanced tab
  5. At the bottom it says virtual memory, then choose change.

Also you can look here

Leader

Read full topic

item.title: Should I upgrade my RAM?
item.dc:creator: @Aftermath.v2 Aftermath.v2
item.description:
@Aftermath.v2 wrote:

The page file is used to store memory to a file, as far as I know. Even if enough RAM is available, data is still stored on the page file. I suggest cleaning up your hard drive of junk (I just cleared 186 Gigabytes of files), uninstall what you don’t need, and defragment your hard drive.

Read full topic

item.title: Should I upgrade my RAM?
item.dc:creator: @minitual minitual
item.description:
@minitual wrote:

The page file is basically where you’re using so much memory that it needs more room and begins writing to the hard drive. This slows down the computer a ton because the hard drive is much slower than memory.

Read full topic
